title: Successful Celebrities- Is It Luck?
content:
Today I have found one post written by an auspicious author that says how we should read the biographical stories made by some successful people, the celebrities,  to get some inspiration.  
 
I am not against this technique at all. I think it could be very interesting to read about the celebrities ( public figures were mentioned as well), but the problem is – what kind of the people should read that? 
 
It is different for an engineer and an artist to read about the famous public personalities and to get equally inspired by their success stories. 
 
There is also another thing to reconsider. It is all about having some luck. They talk about the talent, work and struggle – but when they are asked what and how – the only thing that comes out is that they were themselves. “Just be you!”  
 
Familiar? Yes, well, an engineer can’t be ‘just himself’, he has to put some real muscle into his work. 
 
Successful people made their biographies while being successful, not being unsuccessful.  
 
I want to see a bio from a terrifyingly unsuccessful person who is taking it as a champ. Because most of us are not celebrities, and we can only be inspired by the struggles of the ordinary people, not a billionaire. 
 
Also I want to see that person being rock solid normal and proud of own failure. Then, and only then I will lift up one of those biographies and sincerely take in the consideration, from the bottom of my hearth, to take their struggles seriously.  
 
Why? Because most of these celebrity bios, if not all, are ghostwritten.
